comments.body: By "internal", do you mean "undocumented"? Is this something that users use anyway? If not, you should consider omitting these.

I think you make a valid point,
But I literally took this over from the node project's documentation.
With internal is meant 'for development purposes', such as testing.
I decided to leave the API and the documentation the same as it is over there; this way people can use the exact same API as Firebase's documentation says.
https://www.firebase.com/docs/web/guide/login/custom.html
Perhaps that can be regarded as a bad idea. I'm not sure.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@   *                c) "admin" -- Set to true to bypass all security rules (use this for your trusted servers).
   *                d) "debug" -- Set to true to enable debug mode (so you can see the results of Rules API operations)
   *                e) "simulate" -- (internal-only for now) Set to true to neuter all API operations (listens / puts
   *                                 will run security rules but not actually write or return data)
   *                f) "iat" -- (Number) (internal-only, for testing) Set the issued at time for the generated token
